1533111121121211221122211.title: Saturday night's alright for fighting

choices: Jason bites the bullet and calls his mom
Jason calls Nikki
15331111211212112211222112.content:
Jason stashed the cash he just stolen in the alley then called 911 and reported an attempted mugging. “Yea and send an ambulance while you’re at it, they’re both gonna need it.” Jason had no illusion how this was going to go; he would end up hauled down to the station again, possibly arrested. “Me? No, I’m fine. Right the ambulance is for the two guys who tried to mug me. No really. Yea, I’ll stay here. Jason, Jason Sullivan. Sure.”

Jason stood over Jim and Terry, watching them grow paler with blood loss, listening to the frantic but ineffective breathing from Jim’s perforated diaphragm. He had been right, it did feel good to kick ass. He was still staring at them when the police and ambulance showed up, he didn’t even resist when they cuffed them but he did chide them for kicking the broken root beet bottle across the alley. “Hey, be careful with that thing it’s evidence.”

“What are you, a comedian?”

“No seriously, that’s what I beat them up with when they tried to mug me,” Jason explained as they stuffed him in the back of the car.

“Save it for downtown.”

“Ok, fine,” Jason said with a shrug. He looked around as the car pulled out into traffic. “This is much nicer than the car I got arrested in last night; it had blood all up in it and smelled like puke, this is a class act. I appreciate that you guys are taking care of the stuff my tax dollars are paying for.”

Unlike last night Jason didn’t spend time in a holding cell, it wasn’t the expected room with the bright lights and two-way mirror either. He sat across the desk from a bored looking cop in a suit who took down his statement and asked a few questions. “So when these two guys came up to you did they say they intended to mug you?”

“No, they pulled knives and came at me, I made an assumption.”

The cop grunted, “Yea, we recovered the knives.” There was a long silence after which the cop stopped writing and read from a file next to him.

“So?” Jason prompted him after minutes dragged by.

“So, you were brought to the station last night after you put another boy,” the cop glanced back at his file, “Taylor, in the hospital. And that one was also supposed to be self defense?”

“The best defense is a good offense.”

“Son, now is not the time for you to show me how smart your ass is. I don’t care; I will put you away until I get answers if that’s what I think needs to happen. Don’t make me think you’re a wanna be hard ass who needs a week in the holding cell to learn the error of his ways.” The cop put the file down and folded his hands over it. “Now, why don’t we try this again? Look at it from my point of view. I have three boys in the ER in two nights, all of which you claim attacked you first and yet you don’t have a scratch on you. And you know what else, I can’t get statements from any of them because they are all either unconscious or under heavy sedation. Can you see how this may be of some concern to me?”

Jason bit back the urge to say something sarcastic and sighed instead. “Seriously, last night Brad told me he was going to kick my ass. Told he was going to kick my ass and smiled while he said it. If I had stood there and took a hit from him I would be dead, there isn’t a doubt in my mind, I mean look at the guy, he’s like twice my size. I only managed to knock him down because I surprised him and kept kicking him to keep him down, I was afraid if he got back up that he would kill me.”

“And tonight?”

“Two of Brad’s friends come at me with knives in an alley? I don’t know, I figured they wanted to mess me up because I hurt Brad. They didn’t specifically say they were going to do anything but geez, knives man. I had a root beer bottle; I think I did pretty damn well for myself.”

The cop let out a short barking laugh then forced himself to look stern again. “I know they recovered two knives from the scene, I also know they’re looking into whether or not this is related to what happened last night. I’m not going to hold you but don’t leave town son, don’t make me have to chase you if it comes down to that. It’ll be bad for both of us. Now get the hell out of here.” Jason stood up and the cop stopped him. “Next time leave the root beer bottle and call us huh? Let us do our job, don’t go looking for trouble.”

“Looking for trouble?”

“Don’t try to screw with me kid; I’ve seen it all before. You stood up for yourself and it felt good. Don’t go looking for trouble,” he repeated. Jason nodded and left the police station. He was about to call his mom to come pick him up when he realized how much she would freak out if she knew he had been hauled in two nights in a row. But what other option did he have?
15331111211212112211222112.title: I'm sure I'll live to regret this...

choices: Jason and Nikki have a deep meaningful talk
The talk doesn't go so well
153311112112121122112221122.content:
The phone rang a few times and Jason was about to give up when Nikki finally answered. “Hello?” Her voice sounded angry and guarded.

“Hey,” Jason said as warmly as he could. He waited a minute and not hearing a reaction from Nikki he pushed onward. “I just wanted to call to say thank you.”

“To thank me?”

“Yea, you probably saved my life by warning me that Jim and Terry were after me.”

“Oh my God, are you ok?”

“Yea, yea, I’m fine,” Jason walked a little further away from the entrance to the police station. “They came at me with knives but I’m ok.”

“Knives?” Nikkis voice trilled with panic before suspicion crept into her voice. “What did you do to them? You hurt them didn’t you?”

Jason laughed, he couldn’t help it. “That question is so absurd, sorry, I didn’t mean to laugh,” he sighed and tried to make himself sound reassuring and soothing. “Yes, they got hurt; I hit them with a root beer bottle.”

This time Nikki laughed. “A root beer bottle doesn’t sound so bad.”

“If you only knew,” Jason muttered.

“What was that?”

“Listen, there’s another reason I’m calling. A couple of reasons actually.”

“I’m listening.”

Jason wasn’t sure how to read the almost complete silence he was suddenly faced with. So once again he forged ahead. “I want to talk to you, not on the phone, not at the mall with your friends on one side of the food court and mine on the other, just you and me, you know… talking.”

Nikki let a breath that it sounded like she had been holding for a while. “That actually sounds nice,” she said softly. Jason mentally high fived himself. “Where are you?”

“Yea…” now he was mentally kicking himself. “I’m at the police station again.” Jason tensed up, waiting for Nikki to yell or hang up. Instead she sighed.

“Figures,” he could hear her moving around and then the jingle of car keys. “I’ll be there in a few.” She disconnected and he did a celebratory fist pump.

“Good evening officer,” he said to a cop who walked past him towards the entrance, giving him an odd look.

Jason had worried a little bit that he wouldn’t be able to tell when she pulled up but he shouldn’t have, it was the only convertible driven by a girl with flowing red hair he expected he’d see in front of the police station tonight. “Thanks for picking me up, I appreciate it,” he said as he jumped in and buckled his seat belt.

“Don’t worry about it,” Nikki put the car in gear and pulled away from the police station. “Were you serious about wanting to talk or were you just buttering me up because you needed a ride?”

“C’mon, if I just needed a ride I would have called my mom. Yes, I seriously want to talk.”

This was the first time he had seen Nikki really smile and it was heart melting. “Yea? Ok, then, let’s talk.”
153311112112121122112221122.title: Nikki don't lose that number...

choices: Jason apologizes and promises to Nikki
Jason tries to be macho and doesn’t apologize
1533111121121211221122211221.content:
Nikki drove in silence for a few minutes and Jason leaned back in the seat and stared out the window. Nikki had had driven to the park and nearing the close of the day it was all but empty except for the soothing scenery. It felt good to relax. Today had been an odd day from start to finish. He felt like an outsider in his own life and he noticed that he had a touch of the shakes. The adrenaline rush from his run in with Terry and Jim was long gone and now that he was done putting on the snarky tough guy front he was acknowledging that the whole thing could have gone much, much worse than it had. He wondered what it would have been like to be stabbed and shuddered; hopefully he would never have to find out. In the wake of this strange day he felt empty, stressed and oddly horny. He seemed to recall reading somewhere that people who survived brushes with death or significant harm often reacted with increased libido. There was some primal link between almost dying and wanting to overcompensate for it by spreading your DNA around. He glanced at Nikki and looked away again, trying to shake this train of thought.

“What are you thinking about?” Nikki asked as she turned her car off one of the the park roads, maneuvered somewhat off road, slipping through a set of bushes and parked in a secluded hollow, facing the setting sun.

“Uh,” Jason chose not to tell her he had just been imagining what she would look like with her denim skirt pulled up to her belly button. “You know, thinking about the fight I was just in with Jim and Terry, glad I didn’t get cut. Glad you answered your phone.”

Nikki nodded and shut the car off. The leather of her seat squeaked as she turned to face Jason. “How did that happen anyway?”

“What? The fight with the dumb-ass duo?” Nikki nodded. “Well after I took the bus back from the mall I stopped at the gas station, you know the one right down the street from the bus stop?” Nikki nodded again and Jason continued. “Well I went in to get a soda and Terry ran out as I was coming in. It seemed weird but I figured there wasn’t much I could do about it so I bought a root beer and left. I didn’t see either of them but I figured if someone were watching me I could avoid them by cutting through the alley next to the gas station, well it turned out they were waiting there.” Jason didn’t want to lie to Nikki but he also didn’t want to make it sound like he had gone looking for trouble even if that was what he had done so he was being somewhat selective with what was being left out. “They pulled knives on me and I fought back.”

“With a root beer bottle?”

“With a root beer bottle. I busted it over Terry’s head and stabbed Jim in the gut with the broken end.” Jason watched Nikki’s eyes widen in horror. “Look Nikki, I just did what I had to do to make sure I didn’t get hurt. I even called an ambulance for them so they wouldn’t bleed out.” He figured he’d leave out the part where he had looted them both for nearly two hundred dollars and stashed it in the alley for later.

Nikki still looked horrified, “Tell me this wasn’t like Brad Jason, please tell me.”

“It wasn’t like Brad,” Jason reassured her. “I didn’t kick them while they were down, I just did what I had to defend myself.” Jason paused before continuing. “I don’t know why things went with Brad the way they did,” he said finally.

“I do,” Nikki said, her voice suddenly had a harsh snarling edge to it. “You’re jealous that he’s fucking Laura and you’re not.”

“What? No!” Jason was surprised by Nikki’s reaction. “No,” he repeated. “I mean I know why I hit Brad, I hit him because he threatened to kick my ass,” Jason paused, remembering the condescending threat from the football player, “again,” he clarified. “I mean I don’t know why I snapped and kept hitting him when he was down, I think at first I was afraid that if I let him get up he was going to beat the shit out of me and maybe kill me but I’m not sure at what point I knew he wasn’t getting up and I kept hitting him anyway.” Jason clenched his shaking fists, clearly remembering the rage he had been feeling. It had been about Laura, about feeling let down and betrayed by her when he hadn’t done the same to her when the tables were turned. But it definitely wasn’t about lust.

“So you don’t want to fuck Laura?”

Jason almost sarcastically said something along the lines of “if she offered I wouldn’t say no,” but he could see real pain in Nikki’s eyes that sobered him and tempered his response. Would he have fucked Laura in his “real” reality? The sweet, somewhat awkward girl he had been best friends with since grade school? Absolutely, in fact he realized now that he regretted the fact he hadn’t. But the Laura with the perfect body he had created who’s sweet awkwardness had apparently been replaced by cruelty and selfishness? “No Nikki, I do not want to fuck that bitch. I don’t know how I’ve come off in the past, probably like a moron, but believe me when I say that in the last couple days I have learned in ways that I probably can’t explain very well that it’s what inside that counts more than anything,” Jason struggled to find the words to express his point without telling Nikki about the app and how outward appearances are surprisingly superficial. “Nikki, you are the only one who called me when I was in jail, the only one. Hell, it’s been over twenty four hours and still no one has called. I’m sure that everyone knows about it, news like that travels fast. You’re the only real friend I know I have right now and it tore me up bad today thinking I had fucked that up.”

Jason wasn’t sure at first what Nikki’s reaction was. Her face ran through a gamut of emotion, doubt, surprise, maybe a burst of joy, but it seemed to settle on angry and Jason shifted uncomfortably in his seat, unsure of what to do or say while Nikki’s expression continued to darken. “That bitch,” Nikki said finally. “That manipulative two faced bitch. I knew I shouldn’t have listened to her, but you didn’t make things easier either,” Nikki wiped angrily at the corner of her eye where tears were forming. “Why couldn’t you tell me something like this when we broke up instead of letting me think that you really were just going out with me to get closer to Laura?”

Jason struggled to answer what may have been a simple question if he could actually remember the circumstances of their break-up. He settled for shrugging his shoulders and trying for humor, “Because I’m a socially inept nerd?”

Nikki responded by punching him in the shoulder, not hard enough hurt but hard enough to make him flinch because he absolutely wasn’t expecting it. Before he even had a chance to protest Nikki started laughing. “You were still an ass to me at the mall earlier,” Nikki said with a pout when she finished laughing.

“Maybe a little,” Jason conceded.

“A little?” Nikki punched him again, this time hard enough to sting. This time she wasn’t laughing. “Jason, you were so cold and so…” she struggled to find an appropriate word before settling on, “weird, you have no idea how much it hurt me.” She leaned closer to Jason and lowered her voice but not her intensity. “I won’t go through something like that again, ok? I liked going out with you, for a while it was good. For a while it was VERY good. But let me make this clear now so we don’t have any misunderstandings like apparently happened last time. I want to be with you, and if I’m with you I’m ONLY with you. If you want to be with me I expect the same thing in return. And if we have problems we need to talk about, we’ll talk. Like we’re talking now, but no more of that macho, rude, silent treatment bullshit or whatever it was you were doing earlier today. You need to promise me that ok?”
1533111121121211221122211221.title: Let's talk about you and me

choices: Jason gets up and goes to talk to Monica.
Jason gets up and is distracted by something.
15331111211212112211222112211.content:
Jason was a little surprised at the direction the conversation had taken, “You want us to get back together?” He asked for clarification. Since he couldn’t remember ever being “together” it was a little difficult to wrap his head around the concept.

“Well yea, don’t you?” Nikki looked momentarily taken aback.

“Yes, yes,” Jason quickly reassured her. This would be great for a lot of reasons, Nikki was cute, she seemed like a genuinely nice person and he had the distinct impression that he had few real friends in this reality. “I guess I’m just surprised you wanted to, I thought,” he shook his head and started over. “Never mind what I thought, this is great, yes I promise, I’m sorry for acting like an asshole earlier today.”

“You’re not just saying that?” The question was serious but Nikki’s tone and mischievous smile hinted otherwise.

“Cross my heart.”

“Yay!” Nikki surprised Jason by vaulting over the gear shift and landing in Jasons lap, straddling him. She wrapped her arms tightly around him and he reciprocated, the two kissed passionately and Jason was gasping for air when they stopped. Nikki giggled.

“Wow,” Jason let go as Nikki leaned back, pulling her arms inside her shirt and doing some sort of contortions that ended with her arms popping back out and her bra being tossed aside. He twisted his head around to watch it land in the back seat, doing an actual double take. “How did you…”

“Shirt stays on Jason, someone might walk by and they’re not getting a free show.”

“Wow, Jason repeated. He reached up and confirmed his impression that the fabric of her shirt was so thin it wasn’t much of barrier anyway. Then he no longer had any need to imagine how Nikki might look with her denim skirt hiked up. Nikki smiled at Jason as she unzipped his pants and that image, that smile was burned into memory forever. The sun setting over her shoulder, the fiery play of the light on her red hair, the spray of freckles across her nose and above all that smile, that gorgeous smile.

********************

It was long after dark when Nikki dropped Jason off in front of his house. He kissed her good-bye and she made him promise to call her the next day. “Yea, I have some stuff to do with Colin but I’ll call you when I’m free.” She waved and drove off as Jason stared after her. He stood there, feeling somewhat dazed for a few minutes before turning and heading inside. He was surprised to find his mom up waiting for him; she looked like she had been crying.

“Mom, what’s wrong?” Something had to be wrong; his mom never stressed about how late he was out. Did she?

“When you didn’t come home, or call I was worried that you got into another fight. I don’t know what I would do if one of those bullies put you in the hospital again.”

The hospital? So Brad had kicked his ass bad enough to require hospitalization? He wasn’t about to admit to her that he HAD been in a fight, the fact that he had won probably wouldn’t set her mind at ease. “Mom, it’s ok, I was on a date with Nikki.”

Surprisingly this made his mother perk up considerably. “You got back together with Nikki? I’m happy to hear that, she is such a nice girl. I never understood why you two broke up in the first place.”

“Yea, me neither,” Jason deadpanned. At least his mom approved of his choice in women. Two days ago it seemed like he was trapped in a horrific depressing version of reality, maybe things weren’t quite that bad. “I’m tired, it’s been a long day and I have stuff I need to do in the morning. Jason had apparently missed a text from Colin asking him to stop by around ten. Remembering Monica’s earlier directions he knew he had to be there by at least nine thirty if he wanted to talk with Monica. “I’ll be there,” he texted back. Then he got ready for bed and fell quickly into surprisingly dreamless sleep.
15331111211212112211222112211.title: The best part of an argument is the make up sex

choices: Jason brings Nikki
Jason doesn’t bring Nikki
153311112112121122112221122112.content:
Jason awoke to what felt like someone jumping on his bed, his eyes darted open and his not awake yet senses were met with a mass of curly red hair and the sensation of someone kissing him. Before he could react the kiss was over and the blur of red resolved itself into Nikki’s face. It appeared that she HAD jumped in bed with him. “C’mon sleepyhead, get up. What are we doing today?”

Jason sputtered, trying to get his thoughts together and failing. “We? I was… I had a thing I had…” he finally settled on, “What time is it?”

“It’s late, nearly eight o’clock. Your mom let me in, I think she’s making breakfast for us.” She jerked Jason’s blanket off and looked disappointed. “Boxers? I thought you slept naked?” Before Jason could respond she grabbed hold of his shaft, boxers and all, which was (as it was most mornings) standing at attention. “It’s too bad your mom is home right now. Now c’mon, get up,” she looked down and giggled as she released Jason. “I mean get out of bed.” She rolled out of his bed and stood looking down at him expectantly.

He spent a moment looking at the cute redhead in her tight t-shirt and daisy duke cut-offs and silently screaming out against chipper morning people before he also rolled out of bed. “Ok I’m up,” Jason tossed his blanket back on the bed and started digging through his dresser for something to wear.

“No, wear these, I like how you look in these.” Nikki had apparently already picked out a pair of khaki cargo shorts and a black tank top he didn’t recognize. He shrugged and pulled them on. The tank top was tighter than he was used to wearing and someone had cut the sleeves short, not quite enough to call it a muscle shirt but close.

“Are you sure about this?”

“Of course I’m sure, those shorts make your package look great and that tank top is perfect. Those baggy t-shirts you wear make you look shapeless; this shows you actually have a decent stomach.” She ran her hands over his chest. “Have you been working out? You look REALLY good in this shirt,” before he could answer Nikki gave him a peck on the lips. “I’ll meet you downstairs; don’t keep me waiting too long.”

Jason scratched his head. How was he going to ditch Nikki so he could go talk to Monica? Telling her he wanted her to get lost so he could talk to another girl wasn’t going to work. Maybe he should bring her with? The question ate at him while he went through his morning routine. When he got downstairs Nikki and mother were talking, Nikki was very animated and he spent a minute watching her before he let them know he was there. What had someone who was bubbling over with so much energy ever see in him in the first place? Had he really been dating her just to get closer to Laura? Did it really matter now? “Oh, there you are,” Nikki surprised Jason by bounding out of her chair and almost tackling him with a hug. “C’mon, let’s eat and decide what we’re doing.”
153311112112121122112221122112.title: Wakey wakey

choices: Um… uh…
Wait, I got this…
1533111121121211221122211221122.content:
Jason’s mom had made pancakes that were surprisingly good. He wondered how his paradox would have made her a better cook and got his answer when he said something about how tasty they were. “Thank you, this is the recipe that Nikki gave me, it seemed appropriate.”

Jason nodded and had another bite while he thought about how to approach the fact that he didn’t intend to take Nikki with him to talk to Monica. He really didn’t know much about her and wasn’t sure how to read her this morning. Was this sudden visit charming spontaneity or was this her being overly clingy? He figured he’d start out slow. “Nikki, remember last night when I said I had stuff to do with Colin and that I would call you when I was done?” Nikki nodded while she chewed her way through a mouthful of pancakes. “I’m heading to his place around nine, it shouldn’t take me long, I’ll call you when I’m done, probably by lunch, maybe even before.”

“So what’s this big mysterious thing you have planned with Colin?” Nikki asked after swallowing.

“He wants me to join his band,” Jason said opting for the partial truth. “I’m going to go check out an old guitar or something he’s selling and talk with him about it.”

“Really?” Nikki sounded surprised. “You never struck me as the musical type.”

Jason shrugged, “That’s what I told him but he insists I have “the attitude” to make it work, I think he’s nuts but I thought I’d at least hear him out. I figure it’d be good to try something new you know?”

Nikki laughed. “I must be rubbing off on you; do you want me to drop you off?”

“Who’s Colin?” Jason’s mother finally asked.

“Oh, someone I met a couple days ago, we hung out yesterday, he seems alright.” Items of note missing from the previous statement, I met Colin in Jail and while we were at the mall we shoplifted CD’s together then smoked in the food court to piss off security.

That seemed to satisfy his mother and she left the room. “Don’t forget to rinse off your plates when you’re done, the dishwasher won’t get off dried syrup,” she called after herself.

“I won’t forget mom.”

“Well, do you want me to drop you off or not?” Nikki asked, stabbing the last piece of pancake on her plate.

“Yea, sure.” Jason swallowed the last of his pancake and washed it down with a glass of milk. He made sure to rinse their plates off before they left. He didn’t see any harm in taking her up on her offer.

Jason gave Nikki directions towards Colins house. As they approached he pointed to the gas station by the bus stop. “There’s where it happened.”

“Where what happened?” Nikki slowed down as she tried to see what Jason was pointing at.

“That alley by the gas station, it’s where I had the fight with Jim and Terry last night.”

Nikki made a hard turn into the gas station parking lot. “I want to see it.”

“What? Why?” Jason suddenly wished he had kept his mouth shut.

“Because I want to see it, do I really need a reason?” Nikki shut the car off and got out, Jason scrambled to follow her.

Her low heels clacked quickly into the alley then stopped suddenly, causing Jason to nearly run into her. “Oh my God,” she whispered.

Based on her reaction Jason at first thought that instead of taking the two to the hospital the bodies were still laying there but in reality it was almost worse. A large oblong area was roped off and in the rough center was two surprisingly large blood stains. “It wasn’t as bad as this makes it look,” Jason said finally.

Nikki spun around to look Jason in the eye, “I hope not, because it looks pretty bad. What happened?”

“I told you, I hit Terry in the head with a bottle, it broke and the glass gashed up his scalp pretty good, he fell there,” Jason pointed to the blood stain on the right,” he pretty much just passed out after I hit him.” Jason didn’t think she needed to know how bad the “gashed up scalp” really was. “Then Jim took a swing at me with his knife,“ Jason pantomimed pivoting to his left and ducking, “and I still had the end of the bottle in my hand, so before he had the chance to try stabbing me again I stabbed him, “Jason finished the demonstration by stabbing forward and up like he had last night. “I think I punctured his diaphragm because he had a hard time breathing and passed out pretty quick. That’s when I called 911.”

Nikki shook her head. “That’s horrible. I can’t believe those two would try something like that. I’m glad you’re ok.” She was making a point not to look at the blood anymore and began to walk back to the car. Jason followed her but didn’t get in the car. “What are you waiting for?”

Jason leaned over to kiss her, “You can leave me here, it’s right around the corner from the bus stop. I’ll call you when I’m done.”

“You sure?” Jason nodded. Nikki shrugged then drove away. Jason watched her go then went back into the alley and was relieved to see that the proceeds from his reverse mugging were still where he had left them. He entered the gas station, bought a pack of cigarettes, a lighter and enjoyed a smoke as he walked leisurely to Colin’s house. He checked the time, quarter after nine. “Perfect,” he told himself, knocking firmly on the front door. He was taken aback when the door was opened by a girl he didn’t recognize. She was tall, nearly as tall as he was and she was skinny, nearly unhealthily so, with pale skin and waist length dark hair, which was unkempt and hiding most of her face. Her body language and expression screamed depression, anger, unease with her body and her place in life. She also had probably the largest breasts Jason had ever seen in his life. “I’m here to see Colin, is he home?” Jason asked while he tried to think of a big boob model to compare her to, maybe Wendy Fiore or September Carrino? But neither of them were as skinny as this girl, the extreme disparity between her frame and breast size made it impossible to compare her to anyone and he realized far too late that he was staring and making an ass of himself.

“Take a picture, it’ll last longer,” the girl sneered, moving to close the door.

“Wait,” Jason protested, the door stop just shut of closing all the way.

“I’m not some freak show to be stared at, get lost.”

“I wasn’t staring,” Jason tried to defend himself.

“Bullshit.”

“I wasn’t.” Yea I was, why am I having this argument?

“Fine, prove it, what color are my eyes.”

15331111211212112211222112211222.title: Protip…

choices: Continue because my chapter was too long...
153311112112121122112221122112222.content:
The door slowly opened again and the girl stood back, giving Jason the unspoken permission to enter. Now that he was looking at them here eyes were very green. “Look, I’m sorry,” the girl said as he stepped in. “I get…” she raised her hands and let them fall down to her sides again, an awkward shrug, “I’m sorry,” she said again, moving to the couch in front of the TV and sat down, hunched over with her knees drawn up to her chin. Jason closed the front door behind himself and let his eyes adjust to the dim light. All the blinds were closed and the brightest source of light was the TV which was showing some cartoon show Jason didn’t recognize.

“It’s ok,” Jason said, not sure what else to say. “I…”

“Colin’s room is down the hall on your left,” the girl said, cutting Jason off just as he was about to admit that he had been staring. He thought better of finishing the statement and turned to the left.

“Thanks,” he said to the girls back as he left the room.

“I see you made it past Nyah, you either really did pay attention to more than her boobs or you remembered what I told you. Either way, good work.” Jason almost jumped out of his skin. Monica had come out of seemingly nowhere to stand directly behind him. “And you’re early, which is good, we have a lot to talk about.” Monica waved Jason into what was obviously her room, and though confused he allowed himself to be led. Monica made sure the door was closed and locked, then she grabbed a chair from a makeup table that was overflowing with products and sat on it. “Go ahead and clear off a spot on the bed.” Jason looked around the room which was littered with fashion magazines and moved an armful of them off the end of the bed before sitting down. The walls were plastered with pictures of models from Victoria’s Secret as well as photo spreads he recognized from Maxim, Playboy and other men’s magazines. Most of the pictures had notes scribbled on them and body parts either circled or highlighted.

“What’s with all the…”

“The beauty industry isn’t an exact science, everyone knows that,” Monica said tonelessly as she pulled out her iPhone and began working intently on something. “There is no “perfect look” that is universally accepted as being beautiful, instead you have to find the aspects that appeal to the most people. Nyah for instance,” Monica paused for a moment, appearing engrossed by her phone before tapping something then continuing, “has limited appeal due to her breast size. In certain circles she’d be a superstar, but pure size fetishism has a relatively narrow appeal. Whereas superior form and shape will have a much broader fanbase even at modest size. It’s hard to get serious modeling work if you’re much over a D cup, I’m at DD at the moment and trying to decide whether or not I want to reduce down further. I might leave them as is, if I make the movie transition they appear to boost my success more as DD. Any bigger though and I can’t seem to get past modeling in girly mags. I really hate the thought of going smaller if I don’t have to though.”

“Nyah,” Jason said, sounding out the unfamiliar name, “is she...” Jason mimed the shape of breasts in front of his own chest, “with the app?”

“Not Nee-uh. NI-uh, with a long I sound, and no, she’s all natural. Poor thing.”

“Poor thing?”

“If you didn’t notice she’s miserable, she doesn’t think anyone will notice there’s a real person behind those boobs but she’s too scared to get a reduction because she’s equally afraid that if she does she’ll get no attention at all. But we’ll talk more about her later, let’s talk about you.” Monica turned the phone so Jason could see it. Instead of displaying the muscular version of himself Monica had shown him yesterday it looked like he did now.

“So it’s me, I don’t understand.”

“Of course you don’t understand,” Monica said rolling her eyes. “And this isn’t “you” it’s your last revision.”

“My last what?”

“Oh my God, it’s not that complicated. Each time you change something on yourself you’re revising it. The revisions get saved and numbered.”

“Like a computer program?” Suddenly this was a concept he was familiar with.

“God,” Monica sighed, “I knew you were a nerd.” Monica swiped a long hair back from her face and continued. “This is your last revision, which appears to be what you are now even though your current revision is the beefcake model you gave yourself. Which is fairly nice as those things go, a little over the top but some people are into that sort of thing. But here’s where it gets interesting. Your previous revision, or what you currently are now, is changing, I think it’s trying to sync up to the revision you broke reality with.”

“Sync up how?”

Monica sighed, “Ok, you know that most people burn calories constantly to maintain their body right?” Jason nodded. “Which means if you weighed someone with a precise enough scale they would always be losing tiny amounts of weight as the calories burn right?”

“I suppose that makes sense.”

“You’re not losing weight, you’re gaining weight, a little bit all the time, I haven’t been studying it long enough to accurately gauge it but I would guess around a pound a day, maybe a little bit more, maybe a little bit less.” Jason looked down at himself. “And nice outfit, I was afraid after seeing you yesterday you didn’t really understand how to dress yourself; this may be easier than I thought.”

Jason ignored the jab about his ability to dress himself and asked the question that was bothering him the most. “How can you see the future with that app?”

Monica looked up from her phone and stared at Jason long enough to make him feel uncomfortable before she looked down again. “It can’t “see the future” but you can use it to view profiles at any age. There’s a lot that can be inferred with how your life is going to turn out and you can judge how it might change before you apply changes. You really didn’t read any of this stuff before you started screwing around did you?” Jason morosely shook his head. Ok, here’s the crash course. No one is sure WHO made the app, but a few of us have our suspicions. It works on a pretty simple system, for every change you make you run the risk of screwing something up. How big the risk might be is directly proportional to how drastic the change is. Also change effects are cumulative. So a lot of small changes are somewhat safer than a couple really big ones but it all still adds up, you with me so far?” Jason nodded again. “So if you push the envelope too far and get big time karmic backlash, something bad WILL happen to you. Like for instance, there’s a feature where you can implement changes retroactively, it appears to alter the past itself, that one is like playing dice with the universe. Most people are lucky to get one bump with that setting without running into a paradox.” Suddenly Monica looked at Jason with an expression that made Jason look for the blinking lightbulb over her head. “You didn’t…” Monica trailed off and Jason hung his head and nodded.

“Twice,” he said, answering her unasked question.

Monica swore, “Did you get a paradox warning BEFORE you finished doing what you were doing?” Jason nodded again and Monica swore again. “And did it anyway?” Jason’s nod this time was almost imperceptible. Monica swore like a sailor before continuing. “Well that certainly explains a lot.” Monica looked disgusted. “So as I was saying, this app runs by entering you in a lottery you don’t want to win. YOU, have hit the fucking jackpot.”

“I don’t get it, who would design something like this?”

Monica rolled her eyes, “how many powerful beings can you think of that get off on giving people what they think they want while having the potential for it to horribly blow up in their face the entire time? But I’m not here to have a theological discussion; I’m here to try to fix our mutual problem. Like I said yesterday, whatever you did it’s like you don’t even exist anymore. It’s like it knocked you out of reality AND the reach of the app. Which is why I think your body is trying to sync up to this,” Monica showed Jason the muscular version of himself again.

“So I’m safe then? I don’t really exist as far the app is concerned and I’m getting the body I wanted anyway?”

“God you are naïve. No, when your body finishes syncing up you’re going to get whatever karmic disaster you have coming to you.”
153311112112121122112221122112222.title: But I'm sure they’re green.

choices: Jason walks out, he can’t abandon Nikki
Jason reluctantly agrees
1533111121121211221122211221122221.content:
Jason’s throat suddenly went dry and he tried to swallow but couldn’t. “What do you want me to do?”

Monica’s smile was unsettling. “I have two problems I need fixing. Let’s talk about the first one. Nyah is a wreck, she has assets that will take her very far in certain industries, she hasn’t started down the road to any of them yet but it’s damn near inevitable that she’s going to. When she does, she’s doing to self destruct. Drugs, scandal, the whole nine yards. She’ll take my career out by association.”

“What does that have to do with me?”

“She needs someone to show her that life isn’t as horrible as she thinks it is and that not all guys only see her boobs. You’re already one step farther along than anyone else she’s ever met.”

“Wait, you want me to date your sister?”

“I’m not talking date, I’m talking she falls in love with you and changes her opinion on life and men.”

“If you haven’t used the app on her, do it. Change whatever you have to make her happy, how hard can it be?”

“Did you not listen to anything I said? Every use of the app adds up, I’ve pushed my luck just about as far as I’m willing to. Now you’re in a position to help me and if you do I CAN help you. But not if I waste uses, now do we have a deal or do you walk out that door and wait for karma to run you the fuck over?”
1533111121121211221122211221122221.title: We now continue with our scheduled program

choices: Jason goes with Colin to look at the instruments.
Jason changes his mind, maybe some other time.
15331111211212112211222112211222211.content:
Jason sat there watching Monica mess around with her phone like he wasn't in the room. And she was partially right. At the moment he was so wrapped up in his thoughts he may as well have been on the moon. To him there were too many holes in the story and too many unanswered questions. There was at least one hugely glaring contradiction in Monica's explanation. He was worried about the things that were probably true but at the same time he didn't doubt that she was planning to use him like a pawn for her own gain. The more he thought about it the more he was convinced that she planned to double cross him and not hold up her end of the bargain. And what he kept coming back to was the image from last night of Nikki's smile that had burned itself into his memory like a photograph. "What's the second thing?" He asked finally.

Monica shook her head, "The second one is easier than the first but it's all or nothing, if you can't get past the first one don't bother asking."

"Maybe you should use that app to massage your people skills a little bit, would it kill you to talk to me like you're a human being?"

Monica looked up for a moment to focus her obvious scorn like a search light. "I'm sorry, I almost forgot I'm talking to the guy who single handedly wrecked my life's goals. Thanks for reminding me." She offered a very fake grin before looking back down and continuing. "FYI, they're talking about using some sort of throttle on the app now, either locking users out who don't use it often enough or making existing users deactivate their accounts before letting new ones sign on. Maybe both. If you're not going to help let me know now so I can start making others plans because I have the feeling time is pretty limited."

"Let me think about it and get back to you," Jason said getting up and moving towards Monica's door.

"This counts and deciding not to help," Monica said without looking up from her phone.

Jason left without saying anything else. He stood outside of Monica's door, looking first down the hall towards his left, trying guess which door was Colins, then looking back towards the living room where he could see the back of Nyah's head. He was startled to hear Colin's voice directly behind him, "Hey mate, didn't realize you were here already. Did Nyah let you in? Ah, of course she did. Her royal ice cube doesn't sully her hands with work the peasants can do."

"What?" Even as he verbalized his momentary confusion Jason realized Colin was referring to Monica.

"My younger sister, if you meet her you'll see what I'm talking about. But she doesn't mingle very often with the commoners, she has lofty aspirations. C'mon, I'll show that bass I was talking about, I also managed to "obtain" a guitar last night, I'll let you have first choice at either one."

Jason wasn't sure if he was in the mood for this anymore, part of him just wanted to leave and go crawl into a hole and forget the last few days had ever happened. He felt overwhelmed and lost. He also found himself desperately missing Nikki. Or maybe something like this would be just what he needed to take his mind off his problems.
15331111211212112211222112211222211.title: Sorry but no...

choices: I’ll take the bass
I’ll take the guitar
153311112112121122112221122112222111.content:
Colin’s room was crowded full of music stuff. Instruments, posters, stacks of CD’s and cassette tapes. It wasn’t messy, things were obviously organized but it would be fair to describe it as “cluttered.” A battered old stereo system with cartoonishly oversized speakers dominated the side of the room opposite the bed. Jason noticed that the tousled hair of someone (who Jason assumed to be Wendy) was barely visible in the tangle of sheets and for some reason Jason had the gut feeling that she was naked under there. He couldn’t see that she was naked but it made him oddly uncomfortable.

Colin kicked the bedroom door closed behind them as they entered and Wendy pulled the sheet completely over her head, groaning at the noise. “Here mate, check this out,” Colin pointed to a poster that was hanging on the back of the door. It was a picture of a tall boy with wildly unkempt dark hair. He wore no shirt, a padlocked chain around his neck, a rage filled sneer and a bass guitar. He was also covered with blood. From his mouth, coating his teeth, to splashes all the way down his chest. The poster was equal parts fascinating and unsettling. “Sid Vicious, the bass player for the Sex Pistols.” Colin answered Jasons unspoken question. “That is exactly how you looked the first time I saw you in that holding cell. Covered with blood and still looking angry enough to tell anyone that got in your way to go fuck themselves like you meant it.”

Jason wasn’t sure what to say. Finally he asked, “Was he a good bass player?”

Colin laughed out loud and thumped Jason on the shoulder. “No mate, he was bloody awful. He even had the master himself try to teach him how to play and he couldn’t get it right. Didn’t matter though, he had the attitude, he had the look.”

“The master himself?”

“Right, Lemmy Kilmister, the bass player for Motorhead.” Colin pointed to a picture hanging on the wall near the door. This one had the same dark haired boy with the same lack of shirt and same chain and padlock, though this time he was wearing a leather jacket. He was standing between a blonde girl with a ridiculous amount of makeup and a long haired man with an impressive handlebar mustache. “It’s ancient history mate,” Colin laughed easily and lit a cigarette. He moved across the room and opened the window before turning back to look at Jason. Jason realized he was standing next to the poster of Sid Vicious and that Colin was comparing them.

“I gotta admit,” Jason pulled out a cigarette of his own and lit it. “You’re creeping me out a little.” Colin laughed again and flicked ash into an ashtray that was sitting on the corner of his computer desk. Jason walked closer so he could do the same. “Not to mention the fact that I REALLY know nothing about music.”

Colin shook his head, “Doesn’t matter. I got that part covered. All you have to do is choose an instrument and learn enough to be able to fake it. Music is just as much about the showmanship as it about the skill. The Sex Pistols knew that, or at least their manager did. It’s why Sid got in, he looked the part, he attracted female fans, so what if his playing was rubbish?”

“So you want a no talent punk band?” Jason could feel his interest fading by the second.

“No, you’re taking this too literally,” Colin sighed and tried again. “All bands are rubbish when they first start, it’s fact. And if you worry about not wanting to be rubbish before you start you’ll never start, because people learn by doing. I think you’ll do well in a band; you just need to decide what instrument you want to play and start learning. You LOOK like a badass, when you’re focused you look like you’re capable of anything, I’ve seen it, fans will see it, and that’s the sort of thing they’ll react to. Here, let me show you some stuff that I think might help you decide.”

Colin spent about an hour going through various bands that he liked with Jason. Explaining the type of sounds and music he was looking to create and how the various bands were related to his artistic vision. Jason had to admit that Colin seemed to understand pretty well what it was he was trying to accomplish and he certainly didn’t lack enthusiasm. “Listen to the bass track on this one,” Colin urged, playing a snippet of a bass solo. “Early bay area crossover thrash, nearly the perfect tone.” Colin shifted through genres and sub genres of heavy metal and punk that Jason hadn’t even known existed and they all had the same elements in common, speed and aggression. Colin would stop to point out specific guitar and bass pieces until Jason had completely lost track of what he been listening to.

“It sounds way too complicated to play,” Jason said at one point.

“No, it’s not really that complicated, it sounds complicated because it’s fast. Here, check this out.” Colin picked up a guitar and began playing a slow off tempo rhythm.

“That’s not what they were just playing.”

“Yes it is, it’s called a gallop and it’s what makes a lot of these songs sound faster than they really are,” Colin slowly increased the speed of what he was playing and shortly Jason could see that it really was the same thing.

“That didn’t look hard.”

“It’s really not, try it,” Colin handed Jason the guitar and he took it awkwardly. “Hold down these strings here and here like this.” Colin helped Jason position his fingers then walked him through the strumming, within a few minutes he could play almost as fast as the song Colin had just imitated.

Jason spent a little bit of time messing around with both the bass and the guitar, trying to figure out which one he wanted. By this point he was either amped up on the unusually aggressive music he been listening to, Colin’s enthusiasm or both but he could suddenly picture himself doing this.

“Which will it be mate? I’m only asking a hundred for either one and that includes an amp.”

Jason looked at them both again. On the one hand he liked the rumbling of the bass and the fact it only had four strings made it look like it would be easier to learn faster. On the other hand he really liked the sense of speed that the guitar seemed to produce. He had tried the gallop Colin showed him on both and it just sounded faster on the guitar.
153311112112121122112221122112222111.title: We're a suburbian band

choices: Jason keeps walking
Jason knocks
1533111121121211221122211221122221111.content:
Jason was waffling badly, finally he asked Colin to replay one of the music tracks he had shown him earlier. "The pulling teeth one."

"Anesthesia? Sure mate, Cliff was a visionary eh?" Colin pulled up the song on his iTunes and Jason closed his eyes while listening.

“You’re sure that’s a bass?” Jason asked, having a hard time reconciling some of the unearthly howls and tones with the instrument.

“Yea it’s a bass, he’s using a wah pedal to get that sound out of it.”

“Good enough for me,” Jason handed over the money to Colin and smiled as he picked up the bass. He was interrupted from what he was about to say by his phone chiming.

Nikki had texted him, “almost noon, you ready for lunch?”

“I’m gonna take off Colin, my girlfriend is getting antsy because I’ve been ignoring her.” He was texting her back as he spoke, “meet me at bus stop in ten.”

“Girlfriend? Not the cute little redhead from the mall yesterday?”

Jason actually found himself blushing. “Yea.”

“I wouldn’t want to keep her waiting either if I were you,” Colin said with a wink.

“I’m right here you pig,” Wendy snapped, a pillow flew across the room and hit Colin squarely in the head, his only response was laughter.

Jason picked up his new acquisitions and headed for the door, Colin waved goodbye before he charged his bed with the pillow held high. Jason closed on the door to the sounds of all out pillow warfare and laughter. The sounds were a marked contrast to the sound of crying that was coming from behind Monica’s closed door. Jason was torn, he really wanted to get back to Nikki but at the same time he was curious about what could have broken Monica’s ice cold demeanor. He stared at her door wondering if he she knock or just keep walking.
1533111121121211221122211221122221111.title: God of thunder

choices: Things are fine for a while
Things are not fine at all
15331111211212112211222112211222211111.content:
Jason hesitated by Monica’s door for a maybe a minute, torn between trying to see what was going on with her and just walking away to leave her to her own problems. Finally he turned and walked away. He didn’t think there was hope there, if things really were going to come to a crashing halt when his body finished growing (if it really was growing) then there really didn’t seem to be much he could do about it. He may as well enjoy what he had while he had it. Nyah turned to look over her shoulder when she heard Jason enter the living room on his way to the front door. “Hey,” she said softly. So softly that he wasn’t sure at first if she had actually said anything or if he had heard something from the TV.

“Hey,” he said, pausing.

“I really am sorry about before, I don’t want you to get the wrong impression of me,” her voice was soft and she spoke with a hesitant subdued tone. Jason could only detect the faintest trace of a London accent in her voice, another thing that reinforced his suspicion that Colin played his own accent up.

Jason wasn’t sure how to react, admit that he had been staring? Ignore her? He settled for the fairly passive, “Apology accepted.” Nyah continued to stare at him so he added, “I’m sorry if I made you uncomfortable.” The ghost of a smile appeared and she turned back to the TV. Jason let himself out the front door but as he did he was sure that she had turned to look at him again. He left without looking back.

So Jason walked to the bus stop, carrying his new toys and trying to decide how he would spend the rest of the day. He was firmly sold on his, “live life to its fullest until it blows up in my face,” plan and he couldn’t stop smiling.

“You seriously bought a bass guitar?” Nikki asked incredulously as Jason loaded the bass and amplifier into the trunk of her car.

“Yep,” he closed the truck and jumped into the passenger seat.

“Band or not, no groupies you hear me?” Nikki gave him a kiss before putting the car into gear.

“Nope, but you’ll have to come to our shows to bet them back with a stick,” Jason teased. His mirth vanished as he noticed two figures standing on the side of the road, both of them had ghostly afterimages around their bodies like he had seen on Monica. One was a girl, he couldn’t see her face but based on her size he assumed it was Laura. The other was Terry. Terry had been obviously modified by the app to be taller and more muscular. He glared at Jason as the car went past, Jason could see that someone had also used the app to repair the ghastly wound to his scalp but their was something else about the pair Jason could see but couldn’t understand. Their entire bodies shimmered and swirled with some sort of aura.

“What’s wrong? You look like someone walked over your grave.”

Jason stared straight ahead and tried to suppress the suddenly uneasy feeling in the pit of his stomach. “I’m fine,” he said finally, “just a chill.”
15331111211212112211222112211222211111.title: Turn your back on me

choices: Rumble in the gym
Diplomacy or retreat
153311112112121122112221122112222111112.content:
The next couple weeks passed quickly. Jason and Nikki were spending almost all of their time together which was great. They were spending most of their time at Colin’s where Jason and Colin practiced together and searched for a drummer. When he wasn’t there Jason spent a lot of time scouring the internet for tutorials, you tube videos, anything to help him learn his new instrument. What little free time he had left after those activities vanished when he decided to get a membership at the local gym. He was pretty sure that Monica had at least been right about his body growing at a slow but steady rate and if that was the case it wasn’t just his imagination, Nikki was noticing the gradual changes and was more than enthusiastic about them. In addition to the exercise time itself Jason also found himself doing a lot of research on dieting and exercise, especially for Nikki’s benefit because she insisted on going to the gym with him, and she was vocal about her goals. “Screw, toned and fit,” she declared. “I want to be big and buff, maybe steal some of Laura’s thunder.”

And Laura was another issue. Jason had been doing whatever he could to avoid her and her crowd but he was still seeing people with the unsettling auras. Brad and Jim in addition to Terry, definitely Laura and another girl he didn’t recognize. He thought a few times about talking to Monica about the auras but she was studiously avoiding him, probably with as much effort as he was putting into avoiding Laura.

------------------------------------

Today was a Friday. Jason’s ears were ringing from the jam session he and Colin had just finished and as he packed up his bass he wasn’t sure he heard Nikki correctly at first. “You want who to come with us to the gym?”

“Nyah,” Nikki repeated.

“Ok, but why?” Nikki and Nyah had either hit it off fairly well with each other or they had found friendship born of the fact they were the only two people in Colin’s house (not counting the absent Monica) who weren’t involved in the music making. Wendy recorded everything and ran the mixing board while Jason and Colin played which at first Jason had found odd.

“Have you seen her?” Nikki continued before Jason had the chance to open his mouth and say something along the lines of how hard Nyah was to miss. “She eats horrible and she’s so skinny. A proper diet and exercise would do wonders for her and her self image.” Nikki lowered her voice, “She practically starves herself because she wants her boobs to shrink, she’s kind of self conscious about them.” Jason shook his head, Nikki didn’t seem to see anything wrong with the fact that she appeared to be far more mature and well centered than a girl three years her senior who theoretically should know better. “What’s that look for?”

“Nothing, she can come along, it’s fine.” Jason was curious to see how this would play out, as far as he could tell Nyah never left the house. He wasn’t surprised to see her dressed in bulky sweats even though they did little to hide how well endowed she was.

“Jason is really good at this,” Nikki was telling Nyah as they drove to the gym. Jason was leaning back in the passenger seat with his eyes closed, letting the air wash over him. He loved Nikki’s convertible. Nyah was leaning forward from the back seat, her face almost at Nikki’s shoulder. “He’s gained so much muscle in the last two week it’s unbelievable, what is it honey? Twenty pounds?”

“No, it’s only sixteen or seventeen,” Jason felt awkward about being praised for his bodybuilding prowess when he was pretty sure he would be making the same gains if he sat on his ass and did nothing.

“I don’t think I want to gain a lot of muscle,” Nyah said quietly.

“You can decide that after you get in better shape, you’re practically skin and bone right now, but don’t worry, we’ll help you.” Nikki had approached exercise with the same no holds barred enthusiasm she seemed to approach everything with. Nyah offered a tentative smile in return.

Jason had his doubts about how this was going to turn out but he was pleasantly surprised. Nyah allowed Nikki to lead her through her the same arm routine Nikki was doing. Nyah did a good job ignoring the others in the gym and Nikki encouraged her whenever it looked like she might be losing motivation or was getting to self conscious. Jason went quickly through his own routine, making sure he kept the correct form and lifted enough to get a good pump. He raised his eyebrows when the girl with the aura he didn’t recognize came into the gym as they were wrapping up.

“Nikki, why don’t you and Nyah hit the shower? I’ll finish cleaning this stuff up.”

“Ok…” Nikki said slowly, she glanced around. “Is something wrong?” She didn’t appear to recognize the girl either.

“I don’t think so,” Jason lied. “But I’m kind of in a hurry to get my cute girlfriend to a nice restaurant.” He smiled and Nikki smiled back, giving him a peck on the cheek before gathering up her gym bag and heading towards the shower with Nyah.

Jason finished putting away the weights they had used and gathering their towels when Brad walked in followed by Terry. Despite the fact that Terry’s scalp had obviously been fixed by the app he scratched at the afterimage of the scar while he looked at Jason and grinned wickedly.
153311112112121122112221122112222111112.title: Things are not fine at all

choices: Jason is horribly injured
Jason escapes certain death
1533111121121211221122211221122221111121.content:
Brad and Terry spread out as they both moved in Jasons general direction; far enough apart that he couldn't track them both at the same time. The girl found an empty weight bench and began studiously loading plates on the empty bar. So far no one had said a word but the body language and expressions spoke of barely subdued anger and impending violence. Rather than attempt to reach the showers Jason stopped by an empty weight bench, setting his gym bag down and resting his hands on the empty bar. The pose may have looked casual but Jason was already calculating how he could use the bar as a weapon, choosing where he placed his hands with balance and leverage foremost in his mind. He glanced between the two boys, letting his focus drift from the girl but keeping track of the methodical clanking of steel as she continued to add plate after plate on the bar.

“Hey nerd,” Brad sneered, finally stopping just an inch or two out of kicking distance. Jason could see Terry opening the gym bag he had slung over his shoulder and taking something out of it. He stole a glance and tensed up to see it was a glass root beer bottle. “Look at me when I’m talking to you nerd,” Brad snapped. Jason turned deliberately to face him while still attempting to keep Terry in his peripheral vision. More plates clanked and Jason absently wondered how much weight was being loaded on that bar.

“Good to see you’re walking again,” Jason said finally. “Both of you.” He could see Terry taking a swig of the root beer. Jasons whole body relaxed when Terry lowered the bottle without throwing it or taking a swing at him.

“I like how you’re trying to play the tough guy routine, nerd,” Brad said. “Trying so hard not to act scared. You’ll think you’ll get with Laura if you act hard enough? Is that it?”

“Fuck Laura,” Jason said reflexively, immediately regretting the word choice when both of the jocks laughed.

“I bet you’d like to,” Brad leered. “She’s way better in the sack than the slut you’re going with now, and I should know. Does Nikki still like getting her scalp massaged? Have you tried sucking on the insides of her thighs yet? She really gets off on that.” Jason’s stomach crawled and his knuckles creaked as he gripped the bar tighter.

“What do you want Brad?” Jason said, refusing to give them the satisfaction of seeing or hearing him either angry or afraid.

“I’ll give you credit nerd, you have fast reflexes. And I underestimated you, not a mistake I’ll make again,” Brad continued, ignoring Jason’s question. Brad made a fist and loudly cracked his knuckles.

Jason saw Terry raise the bottle and anticipated more than saw the throw, already ducking and lifting the bar, arcing the bar towards Terry’s projectile. The spinning bar caught the bottle in midair shattering it but Jason was shocked at the speed it had been thrown, broken glass sliced his cheek and the empty weight bar vibrated in his hands from the impact. The bar was knocked from his hands, more by accident than design as Brad ran into its continued arc. Losing his grip on the bar Jason elbowed Brad hard in the gut and winced as it felt like he hit a brick wall. Before he could do anything else Terry and Brad each grabbed one of his arms in a viselike grip and shoved him down on a weight bench, holding him in place. He struggled against them but it was like struggling against iron. They were far stronger than they looked.

“Little bitch,” Terry spit. “I wanted to slice your fucking head open but you broke the bottle.”

Jason was about to make an observation about being outnumbered (again) when Brad and Terry roughly jerked him into a sitting position. “Pay attention nerd,” Brad sneered.

“Is nerd really the only insult you know?” Jason’s voice trailed off as he realized they had lifted him up enough so he could watch the unknown girl finish loading plates on the bar. There was a ridiculous amount of weight on it, so much so that the Olympic sized bar was drooping comically from the middle. If he had to guess Jason would have estimated the weight currently on the bar at over a thousand pounds. The girl reached out both hands and with a smooth motion curled the bar up off the support. She stood there, facing Jason with a feral smile plastered across her face as her arms visibly thickened. Her entire torso swelled with muscle until her previously loose fitting t shirt began to tear around her delts and lats. The aura surrounding her swirled angrily and she began to walk towards Jason, still holding the overloaded bar to her chest.

“Good thing you’ve been working out nerd, now let’s see how good your one rep max is.” Jasons skin crawled as all three began to laugh. Brad and Terry forced Jason back down on the weight bench and jerked his arms roughly into a ninety degree angle. Jasons vision was suddenly eclipsed by the girl who was placing the bar in his hands. “Catch,” Brad said laughing.

Jason tried struggling but he had no leverage, his mind frantically ran through his options as he felt the weighted bar settle into his hands. The girl let go and Jasons arms collapsed painfully under the weight, he realized after a moment of intense fear that he hadn’t been crushed to death and saw that the girl had caught the weight bar just before it would have impacted his chest. “That’s no good, nerd. You’ll have to do better than that,” Brad laughed as the girl raised the bar again. Jason’s arms ached and he winced as Brad and Terry forced him to extend them again.

“I think you broke my elbow,” Jason hissed as he jerked his right arm ineffectually against Terry’s grip.

“Sucks to be you don’t it?”

“Yea, it does,” Jason said through gritted teeth. “And you assholes set me on a giant piece of broken glass, fucking pricks…”

“Glass? Give it here,” Terry jerked Jason up into a sitting position and let go of his wrist to sweep his hand over the bench. Whether it was to get his hands on the (non-existent) glass so he could carve Jason up with it or whether he was actually concerned for Jason’s comfort Jason was unsure. But Jason didn’t hesitate to drive his (unbroken) elbow into Terry’s crotch as hard as he could. Terry let go of Jason’s shoulder to grasp his wounded manhood but before Jason could do anything else Brad pinned him back down to the bench. The girl stood immobile, apparently waiting for Brad to get Jason back under control and move out of the way so she could drop the weight bar on him again.

“What is going on here?” Jason tried to see who was talking but they weren’t in his currently limited field of vision that mostly consisted of Brad’s armpit and the girl looming above him.

“Nothing, helping spot my friend while he works out,” Brad stood up and let go of Jason. Jason coughed and rubbed his throat, doing a double take at the girl who had racked the ridiculous weight and now looked like she did when she first entered the gym. Terry limped and shuffled away from the owner who was glaring at the group with an air of righteous indignation.

“This equipment is not a playground and the weights aren’t toys. I catch you horsing around in here again and you’re banned, and no, membership dues will not be refunded.” The ex bodybuilder with the buzzed hair cut an imposing figure but Jason was pretty sure that these three could use him to mop the floor with little effort. Jason was surprised but they allowed themselves to be stared down. Muttering under his breath Brad exited the gym and the other two followed him. Jason tried to slink towards the showers but the owner stopped him. “I’m not sure what that was about but the same goes for you, I don’t need anyone causing trouble here understand?”

Jason nodded his head. “I just want a place to work out and not get in trouble,” Jason offered.

“Then we’ll get along fine,” the owner turned on his heel and stalked back to the front desk. Jason showered as quickly as possible but Nikki and Nyah were already waiting for him when he got back to the lobby.

“There you are, I was just about to text you to see where you ran off to,” Nikki gave him a peck on the cheek and he tried not to cringe back. He couldn’t help but think of her being with Brad and it made his stomach turn. He was making it up Jason told himself, he was making it up to fuck with me… Nikki interrupted that morbid train of thought, “What did you do to your face?” She poked at the cut the flying glass had inflicted on his cheek.

“Cut myself shaving,” Jason said. Nikki frowned at the extremely obvious lie but let it pass without comment.

“C’mon, let’s drop Nyah back at her place and go get some food like you were talking about. What place did you have in mind?”

1533111121121211221122211221122221111121.content:
"Um," Jason forced himself to bury his revulsion at the thought of Brad and Nikki together and his fear at the recent attack in an attempt to focus, "Mickey's?" He said it more as a question than a statement as he held open the door for the girls.

Nikki wrinkled her nose as she walked past, "A burger joint? Really? Try again Romeo."

"How about..." Jason trailed off as his attention shifted to a unique spectacle. Almost directly in front of the gym was a pickup truck that had literally been ripped in two, the halves stacked on top of each other and then impaled with what looked like a lightpole. For a moment Jason wanted to believe it was some kind of performance art or sculpture but then he noticed the gym's owner standing near it, screaming into a cell phone. He couldn't make out what he was saying but did it really matter? Jason didn't even look twice at the bizarre scene, he was instantly certain it had been caused by Brad and company.

"What do you think happened there?" Nikki wondered aloud as they walked past to reach her car.

"I think it doesn't concern us and that I want to keep it that way," Jason said. He frowned, that had come out much more coldly than he had meant it to. "It just looks really fucked up and I don't want us to get involved," he clarified as he glanced around the parking lot for any sign of Brad, Terry or the mysterious girl. The coast looked clear.

"I agree with Jason," Nyah said softly, surprising both of the others. "It freaks me out."

"Yea, I can't argue with that," Nikki said as she unlocked her car.

Jason climbed into the passenger seat, still wracking his brain for a place to go out for dinner with Nikki, anything to take his mind off of the night he had been having so far. Italian seemed too cliche, "Chinese?" He said, now just throwing ideas at a mental dart board.

Jason tried not stare at the destroyed truck as Nikki pulled out of the parking lot, "Sure," Nikki agreed, "which one?" Jason groaned inwardly, he just wanted to shut his brain off and stop thinking about anything.

"Have you guys tried the place over near the mall? Not the one right at the Mall, it's about a mile away, I can't remember what it's called. It's near that old record shop Colin goes to when he wants to buy something on vinyl. It looks like a hole in the wall but the food is really good." This may have been the most Jason had ever heard Nyah say at once.

"Sounds good to me," Jason said, just wanting to get the choice made so he could try to shut off his brain and relax. He was so relieved when Nikki agreed as well. He almost immediately zoned out, barely even noticing when Nyah said good bye to him when they dropped her off.

"You're going to have to at least guide me to the record store Nyah was talking about," Nikki said, breaking into Jason's thoughts. He groaned with displeasure. "Are you OK?" Nikki asked, a note of concern in her voice.

"I'm fine. Just head towards the mall for now," he directed.

"Sure." A moment of silence crawled by. "Are you going to tell me what really happened to your face now that Nyah is gone?"

Jason groaned again, "I got into another fight with Brad and Terry again. And some other girl I didn't recognize," He had momentarily debated lying about it again or just leaving Nikki in the dark but he hoped that getting it out in the open would allow them to get through this and behind them quickly.

"You fought a girl?" Nikki looked away from the road to give Jason the full force of her glare. "What did we talk about before?"

Jason began laughing which visibly annoyed Nikki even further. "It wasn't much of a fight, they held me down to a weight bench and were going to kill me by putting more weight on me than I could lift. They were also going to carve me up with a broken glass bottle as revenge for what I did earlier, the gym owner broke it up though, he probably saved my life. I'm guessing that's why they trashed his truck while I was in the showers."

"How... how can you sound so calm about this?"

Jason shrugged. "I don't know I have other things on my mind I guess," like the thought of you fucking Brad, he almost said but didn't.

"Like what?" Nikki said incredulously.

"Like sex with you."

Nikki was momentarily stunned speechless. "Oh," she actually blushed. "OK then..."

"Turn left up here. The record shop is a couple blocks over on the right, not sure where the Chinese place is," Jason said.

"Wait, you think they trashed that truck? How on earth would they be able to do that?"

Jason shrugged, "I''m not really sure, just a feeling."

The Chinese place was only a few doors down from the record shop and they easily found it. It did look like a hole in the wall and the interior was sparsely decorated and dingy looking. The food was very good however, better than Jason was expecting though he had to concentrate to actually taste it. His mind kept drifting back to the thought of Brad screwing Nikki. "It doesn't matter," he kept telling himself, "she's with me now, so even if it is true he's probably just jealous. He's probably lying to piss me off anyway."

"Are you sure you're OK?" Nikki asked after their attempts at conversation stalled out again as his mind drifted away.

"I'm trying to be. I made a promise to myself recently that I'm going to live life to the fullest no matter what happens because I don't know how long I have left. I'm not going to waste any of my time moping around if I can help it."

"That sounds pretty bleak, it's not like you have a terminal disease or something," Nikki stopped eating for a second, "You don't do you?"

Jason laughed, "no, nothing like that." Well it was sort of like that if Monica hadn't been lying about what was going to happen when his body finished syncing with the paradoxed app profile.

"There's something you're not telling me isn't there?" Nikki accused after swallowing a mouthful of food.

Jason looked down at his plate for a moment before replying. "Yea, there is. It's hard to believe and it will lead to a very long conversation I don't feel like having right now. So right now I want to finish this food then go park somewhere and have wild crazy sex in your car like I know you like. It's not that I don't trust your or want to hide things from you, I have my reasons and I'll explain them, I just really don't want to get into it right now because tonight has been rough and I want to have something good happen sooner rather than later."

A range of conflicting emotions passed over Nikki's face, for a moment Jason was sure this was going to lead to an argument. Finally Nikki spoke, "OK, but you better know a good place to park that's nearby."

He smiled. "I think I know a spot," he signaled for the check.

=================================

In a short time they were parked in the alley behind the record shop, tucked out of sight between the blank back wall of the building and a row of dumpsters. Jason had his seat slid back and reclined as far as it would go while Nikki straddled him. They were progressing quickly past making out, Jason was unusually aggressive, trying to work past the recurring images of Brad and Nikki having sex with each other, feeling more and more frustrated as everything he did to try to push the image out of his head only seemed to make it come back again quicker and with more intensity. Nikki gasped with pleasure as Jason pulled her shirt and bra up and began licking and sucking at her nipples. "Wow,' she breathed, starting to undo his pants and pull up her skirt.

"Not yet, I want to try something first," Nikki squeaked with surprise as Jason cradled her head and leaned her back, with a little maneuvering he had her laying with her legs hooked over his shoulders and her head down near his ankles, he surprised himself with his own strength, holding her waist towards his face as he teased her with his tongue. She moaned with anticipation. "Have you tried sucking the inside of her thighs yet? She really gets off on that," Brads words echoed in his head, part of him didn't want to see whether or not it was true, part of him wanted to just assume that Brad was lying to him to piss him off. But the other part was never going to stop wondering. Jason locked his mouth around the inside of Nikki's creamy thigh, as high as he was able to and sucked at it. She squealed and bucked with obvious delight.

"Oh my God, Jason that feels so good," she purred.

Jason felt like crying but he continued anyway.
